c74object.name: link.phasor~
c74object.digest: Synchronize phase with a Link timeline
c74object.description:
Synchronize phase with a Link timeline. Ableton Link ia a technology that synchronizes musical beat, tempo, and phase across multiple applications running on one or more devices.
Note that each instance of link.phasor~ is a separate participant in the Link timeline. As a result, each link.phasor~ instance may be slightly out of phase with an others. If you need precisely the same phase it is advised to use a single link.phasor~ object to drive your entire patcher.
Ableton Link is licensed for use within Max.If you would like to incorporate Link support into a Max standalone application, it will require a specific license for your application.If you are a standalone developer interested in including Link support, please contact Ableton at link-devs@ableton.com for more license related information.For more technical information on Link, please visit https://ableton.github.io/link/.

attribute.name: peers
attribute.digest: Number of participants in the Link session
attribute.description: Number of participants in the Link session.

attribute.name: quantum
attribute.digest: The number of beats in a group
attribute.description: The number of beats in a group. Quantum could be thought of as the number of beats in a bar or measure. However, quantum could be any arbitrary number of beats and is not linked directly to a host or timeline. Integer numbers will work best for quantum, thought decimal values are also permitted.

attribute.name: tempo
attribute.description: Tempo in beats per minute. Setting the tempo will set it for all participants in the Link timeline.
